page.title: 06SUMMER FETE 1985
page.content: This year our Summer Fete had a 'Country Fayre' theme -this was a time when most people had to make their own amusements.The Fayre was opened by the 'Fete Queen' and her attendants on a beautiful sunny afternoon.There were demonstrations of lace making,corn dollies and pottery.There were also donkey rides for the children and strawberry teas for the adults.The children of the school gave an exhibition of country dancing and singing.There was also an exhibition of dancing by the Morris Men. This fete has been going on for many years and people from all around the district came and joined in the fun. The proceeds of the fete,which this year raised about Â£1,000,will be divided between the church and the school.
